logic

Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.GameMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Updatable

    public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Updatable
    The game's map is a field where Actors can interact and a grid, on which the entities can move. This map takes care of updating the Actors on the map and also can be serialized.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      GameMap(int column, int row)

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        Need for Serialization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • grid

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Tile>> grid
        Arrays of tiles.

      • actors

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Actor> actors
        The actors on the map. (Non tiles.)

      • actorsToAdd

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Actor> actorsToAdd
        Actors to add after an update cycle ends not interrupting the cycle. Acts like a buffer.

      • actorsToRemove

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Actor> actorsToRemove
        Actors to remove after an update cycle ends not interrupting the cycle. Acts like a buffer.

      • gameCanvas

        private GameCanvas gameCanvas
        The canvas which has this game map. If the game has been won or lost, we can communicate the outcome with this canvas.

      • player

        private Player player
        The single player of this game map. Some actors may use this actor's attributes.

      • playerSpawn

        private PlayerSpawn playerSpawn
        The single player spawn of this game map. The player use this to spawn on this map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMap

        public GameMap(int column,
               int row)
        Fills the grid array with empty tiles with the given sizes.
        Parameters:
        column - Number of columns of the map.
        row - Number of rows of the map.

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayerSpawn

        public void setPlayerSpawn(PlayerSpawn playerSpawn)
        Sets the current player spawn on the map. Used in the editor.
        Parameters:
        playerSpawn - the new player spawn.

      • getPlayerSpawn

        public PlayerSpawn getPlayerSpawn()

        the current player spawn of the map.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • addActorToBuffer

        public void addActorToBuffer(Actor a)
        Add the actor to a buffer not to interrupt the current update cycle.
        Parameters:
        a - the actor to add to this buffer. Will be added to the updating scene after a cycle ends.

      • removeActorFromBuffer

        public void removeActorFromBuffer(Actor a)
        Add the actor to a buffer not to interrupt the current update cycle.
        Parameters:
        a - the actor to add to this buffer. Will be removed from the updating scene after a cycle ends.

      • addActor

        public void addActor(Actor a)
        Directly add an actor to the scene list. Used in the editor, where there is no clock.
        Parameters:
        a - the actor to add to the scene.

      • removeActor

        public void removeActor(Actor a)
        Directly remove an actor from the scene list. Used in the editor, where there is no clock.
        Parameters:
        a - the actor to remove from the scene.

      • getActors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Actor> getActors()
        Returns:
        gets the actors on the game map. (Non tiles.)

      • setGameCanvas

        public void setGameCanvas(GameCanvas gameCanvas)
        Sets the current game canvas in which this game map is modified and displayed.
        Parameters:
        gameCanvas - the current game canvas.

      • getColumnNum

        public int getColumnNum()
        Returns:

        public int getRowNum()
        Returns:
        the number of rows of the map's grid.

      • getGrid

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Tile>> getGrid()
        Returns:
        the grid of tiles of the map.

      • setGridSize

        public void setGridSize(int column,
                        int row)
        Sets the new map size, trying to conserve the original map.
        Parameters:
        column - this variable is the new column size of the map.
        row - this variable is the new row size of the map.

      • gameWon

        public void gameWon()
        Notifying the canvas that the game has ended with the player winning.

      • gameLost

        public void gameLost()
        Notifying the canvas that the game has ended with the player losing.

      • getGameCanvas

        public GameCanvas getGameCanvas()
        Returns:
        the current game canvas this map is displayed on.

      • tick

        public void tick(double dtime)
        Updates all the actors in the scene and grid. In the end, updates the actors in the scene, preventing any problem in the middle of the cycle.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Updatable
        Parameters:
        dtime - time passed from the previous update.
